p: The target samples included adults, larvae, and frass of A. bungii. Adults and larval specimens were supplied by the Department of Agricultural Sciences of the University of Naples “Federico II” and the Plant Health Service of the Campania region. In some farms situated in the pest outbreak area around Naples (Campania, Italy), where A. bungii is considered as established (Carella 2019), frass samples (Fig. 1) were collected at the trunk base of Prunus plants and individually labeled as in Rizzo et al. ( 2020a).
